summary.long: Deuteronomy is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: These are the words that Moses spoke to all Israel beyond the Jordan in the wilderness, in the Arabah opposite Suph, between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is eleven days' journey from Horeb by the way of Mount Seir to Kadesh-barnea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, Moses spoke to the people of Israel according to all that the Lord had given him in commandment to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: after he had defeated Sihon the king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, who lived in Ashtaroth and in Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beyond the Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses undertook to explain this law, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord our God said to us in Horeb, ‘You have stayed long enough at this mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turn and take your journey, and go to the hill country of the Amorites and to all their neighbors in the Arabah, in the hill country and in the lowland and in the Negeb and by the seacoast, the land of the Canaanites, and Lebanon, as far as the great river, the river Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I have set the land before you. Go in and take possession of the land that the Lord swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give to them and to their offspring after them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time I said to you, ‘I am not able to bear you by myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God has multiplied you, and behold, you are today as numerous as the stars of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord, the God of your fathers, make you a thousand times as many as you are and bless you, as he has promised you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can I bear by myself the weight and burden of you and your strife?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Choose for your tribes wise, understanding, and experienced men, and I will appoint them as your heads.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you answered me, ‘The thing that you have spoken is good for us to do.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the heads of your tribes, wise and experienced men, and set them as heads over you, commanders of thousands, commanders of hundreds, commanders of fifties, commanders of tens, and officers, throughout your tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I charged your judges at that time, ‘Hear the cases between your brothers, and judge righteously between a man and his brother or the alien who is with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not be partial in judgment. You shall hear the small and the great alike. You shall not be intimidated by anyone, for the judgment is God's. And the case that is too hard for you, you shall bring to me, and I will hear it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I commanded you at that time all the things that you should do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then we set out from Horeb and went through all that great and terrifying wilderness that you saw, on the way to the hill country of the Amorites, as the Lord our God commanded us. And we came to Kadesh-barnea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said to you, ‘You have come to the hill country of the Amorites, which the Lord our God is giving us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, the Lord your God has set the land before you. Go up, take possession, as the Lord, the God of your fathers, has told you. Do not fear or be dismayed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all of you came near me and said, ‘Let us send men before us, that they may explore the land for us and bring us word again of the way by which we must go up and the cities into which we shall come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thing seemed good to me, and I took twelve men from you, one man from each tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they turned and went up into the hill country, and came to the Valley of Eshcol and spied it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took in their hands some of the fruit of the land and brought it down to us, and brought us word again and said, ‘It is a good land that the Lord our God is giving us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet you would not go up, but rebelled against the command of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you murmured in your tents and said, ‘Because the Lord hated us he has brought us out of the land of Egypt, to give us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where are we going up? Our brothers have made our hearts melt, saying, “The people are greater and taller than we. The cities are great and fortified up to heaven. And besides, we have seen the sons of the Anakim there.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to you, ‘Do not be in dread or afraid of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God who goes before you will himself fight for you, just as he did for you in Egypt before your eyes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the wilderness, where you have seen how the Lord your God carried you, as a man carries his son, all the way that you went until you came to this place.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet in spite of this word you did not believe the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who went before you in the way to seek you out a place to pitch your tents, in fire by night and in the cloud by day, to show you by what way you should go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And the Lord heard your words and was angered, and he swore,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Not one of these men of this evil generation shall see the good land that I swore to give to your fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh. He shall see it, and to him and to his children I will give the land on which he has trodden, because he has wholly followed the Lord!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even with me the Lord was angry on your account and said, ‘You also shall not go in there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua the son of Nun, who stands before you, he shall enter. Encourage him, for he shall cause Israel to inherit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for your little ones, who you said would become a prey, and your children, who today have no knowledge of good or evil, they shall go in there. And to them I will give it, and they shall possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, turn, and journey into the wilderness in the direction of the Red Sea.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you answered me, ‘We have sinned against the Lord. We ourselves will go up and fight, just as the Lord our God commanded us.’ And every one of you fastened on his weapons of war and thought it easy to go up into the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, ‘Say to them, Do not go up or fight, for I am not in your midst, lest you be defeated before your enemies.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I spoke to you, and you would not listen; but you rebelled against the command of the Lord and presumptuously went up into the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Amorites who lived in that hill country came out against you and chased you as bees do and beat you down in Seir as far as Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you returned and wept before the Lord, but the Lord did not listen to your voice or give ear to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you remained at Kadesh many days, the days that you remained there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then we turned and journeyed into the wilderness in the direction of the Red Sea, as the Lord told me. And for many days we traveled around Mount Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You have been traveling around this mountain country long enough. Turn northward
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and command the people, “You are about to pass through the territory of your brothers, the people of Esau, who live in Seir; and they will be afraid of you. So be very careful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not contend with them, for I will not give you any of their land, no, not so much as for the sole of the foot to tread on, because I have given Mount Seir to Esau as a possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall purchase food from them with money, that you may eat, and you shall also buy water from them with money, that you may drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God has blessed you in all the work of your hands. He knows your going through this great wilderness. These forty years the Lord your God has been with you. You have lacked nothing.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So we went on, away from our brothers, the people of Esau, who live in Seir, away from the Arabah road from Elath and Ezion-geber.
“And we turned and went in the direction of the wilderness of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, ‘Do not harass Moab or contend with them in battle, for I will not give you any of their land for a possession, because I have given Ar to the people of Lot for a possession.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Emim formerly lived there, a people great and many, and tall as the Anakim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like the Anakim they are also counted as Rephaim, but the Moabites call them Emim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Horites also lived in Seir formerly, but the people of Esau dispossessed them and destroyed them from before them and settled in their place, as Israel did to the land of their possession, which the Lord gave to them.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Now rise up and go over the brook Zered.’ So we went over the brook Zered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the time from our leaving Kadesh-barnea until we crossed the brook Zered was thirty-eight years, until the entire generation, that is, the men of war, had perished from the camp, as the Lord had sworn to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed the hand of the Lord was against them, to destroy them from the camp, until they had perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So as soon as all the men of war had perished and were dead from among the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord said to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Today you are to cross the border of Moab at Ar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you approach the territory of the people of Ammon, do not harass them or contend with them, for I will not give you any of the land of the people of Ammon as a possession, because I have given it to the sons of Lot for a possession.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (It is also counted as a land of Rephaim. Rephaim formerly lived there—but the Ammonites call them Zamzummim—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a people great and many, and tall as the Anakim; but the Lord destroyed them before the Ammonites, and they dispossessed them and settled in their place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as he did for the people of Esau, who live in Seir, when he destroyed the Horites before them and they dispossessed them and settled in their place even to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the Avvim, who lived in villages as far as Gaza, the Caphtorim, who came from Caphtor, destroyed them and settled in their place.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Rise up, set out on your journey and go over the Valley of the Arnon. Behold, I have given into your hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land. Begin to take possession, and contend with him in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This day I will begin to put the dread and fear of you on the peoples who are under the whole heaven, who shall hear the report of you and shall tremble and be in anguish because of you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon the king of Heshbon, with words of peace, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Let me pass through your land. I will go only by the road; I will turn aside neither to the right nor to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall sell me food for money, that I may eat, and give me water for money, that I may drink. Only let me pass through on foot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as the sons of Esau who live in Seir and the Moabites who live in Ar did for me, until I go over the Jordan into the land that the Lord our God is giving to us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Sihon the king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him, for the Lord your God hardened his spirit and made his heart obstinate, that he might give him into your hand, as he is this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, ‘Behold, I have begun to give Sihon and his land over to you. Begin to take possession, that you may occupy his land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Jahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord our God gave him over to us, and we defeated him and his sons and all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we captured all his cities at that time and devoted to destruction every city, men, women, and children. We left no survivors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the livestock we took as spoil for ourselves, with the plunder of the cities that we captured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Aroer, which is on the edge of the Valley of the Arnon, and from the city that is in the valley, as far as Gilead, there was not a city too high for us. The Lord our God gave all into our hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only to the land of the sons of Ammon you did not draw near, that is, to all the banks of the river Jabbok and the cities of the hill country, whatever the Lord our God had forbidden us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then we turned and went up the way to Bashan. And Og the king of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to me, ‘Do not fear him, for I have given him and all his people and his land into your hand. And you shall do to him as you did to Sihon the king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord our God gave into our hand Og also, the king of Bashan, and all his people, and we struck him down until he had no survivor left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we took all his cities at that time—there was not a city that we did not take from them—sixty cities, the whole region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were cities fortified with high walls, gates, and bars, besides very many unwalled villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we devoted them to destruction, as we did to Sihon the king of Heshbon, devoting to destruction every city, men, women, and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the livestock and the spoil of the cities we took as our plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we took the land at that time out of the hand of the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, from the Valley of the Arnon to Mount Hermon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (the Sidonians call Hermon Sirion, while the Amorites call it Senir),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the cities of the tableland and all Gilead and all Bashan, as far as Salecah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For only Og the king of Bashan was left of the remnant of the Rephaim. Behold, his bed was a bed of iron. Is it not in Rabbah of the Ammonites? Nine cubits was its length, and four cubits its breadth, according to the common cubit.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When we took possession of this land at that time, I gave to the Reubenites and the Gadites the territory beginning at Aroer, which is on the edge of the Valley of the Arnon, and half the hill country of Gilead with its cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, that is, all the region of Argob, I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh. (All that portion of Bashan is called the land of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jair the Manassite took all the region of Argob, that is, Bashan, as far as the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and called the villages after his own name, Havvoth-jair, as it is to this day.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Machir I gave Gilead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to the Reubenites and the Gadites I gave the territory from Gilead as far as the Valley of the Arnon, with the middle of the valley as a border, as far over as the river Jabbok, the border of the Ammonites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Arabah also, with the Jordan as the border, from Chinnereth as far as the Sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, under the slopes of Pisgah on the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I commanded you at that time, saying, ‘The Lord your God has given you this land to possess. All your men of valor shall cross over armed before your brothers, the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only your wives, your little ones, and your livestock (I know that you have much livestock) shall remain in the cities that I have given you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the Lord gives rest to your brothers, as to you, and they also occupy the land that the Lord your God gives them beyond the Jordan. Then each of you may return to his possession which I have given you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I commanded Joshua at that time, ‘Your eyes have seen all that the Lord your God has done to these two kings. So will the Lord do to all the kingdoms into which you are crossing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not fear them, for it is the Lord your God who fights for you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I pleaded with the Lord at that time, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘O Lord God, you have only begun to show your servant your greatness and your mighty hand. For what god is there in heaven or on earth who can do such works and mighty acts as yours?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please let me go over and see the good land beyond the Jordan, that good hill country and Lebanon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord was angry with me because of you and would not listen to me. And the Lord said to me, ‘Enough from you; do not speak to me of this matter again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go up to the top of Pisgah and lift up your eyes westward and northward and southward and eastward, and look at it with your eyes, for you shall not go over this Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But charge Joshua, and encourage and strengthen him, for he shall go over at the head of this people, and he shall put them in possession of the land that you shall see.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we remained in the valley opposite Beth-peor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now, O Israel, listen to the statutes and the rules that I am teaching you, and do them, that you may live, and go in and take possession of the land that the Lord, the God of your fathers, is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not add to the word that I command you, nor take from it, that you may keep the commandments of the Lord your God that I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your eyes have seen what the Lord did at Baal-peor, for the Lord your God destroyed from among you all the men who followed the Baal of Peor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you who held fast to the Lord your God are all alive today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I have taught you statutes and rules, as the Lord my God commanded me, that you should do them in the land that you are entering to take possession of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep them and do them, for that will be your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples, who, when they hear all these statutes, will say, ‘Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what great nation is there that has a god so near to it as the Lord our God is to us, whenever we call upon him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what great nation is there, that has statutes and rules so righteous as all this law that I set before you today?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Only take care, and keep your soul diligently, lest you forget the things that your eyes have seen, and lest they depart from your heart all the days of your life. Make them known to your children and your children's children—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how on the day that you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb, the Lord said to me, ‘Gather the people to me, that I may let them hear my words, so that they may learn to fear me all the days that they live on the earth, and that they may teach their children so.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you came near and stood at the foot of the mountain, while the mountain burned with fire to the heart of heaven, wrapped in darkness, cloud, and gloom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to you out of the midst of the fire. You heard the sound of words, but saw no form; there was only a voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he declared to you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, that is, the Ten Commandments, and he wrote them on two tablets of stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and rules, that you might do them in the land that you are going over to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore watch yourselves very carefully. Since you saw no form on the day that the Lord spoke to you at Horeb out of the midst of the fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beware lest you act corruptly by making a carved image for yourselves, in the form of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the likeness of any animal that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged bird that flies in the air,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the likeness of anything that creeps on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the water under the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And beware lest you raise your eyes to heaven, and when you see the sun and the moon and the stars, all the host of heaven, you be drawn away and bow down to them and serve them, things that the Lord your God has allotted to all the peoples under the whole heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord has taken you and brought you out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be a people of his own inheritance, as you are this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, the Lord was angry with me because of you, and he swore that I should not cross the Jordan, and that I should not enter the good land that the Lord your God is giving you for an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I must die in this land; I must not go over the Jordan. But you shall go over and take possession of that good land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take care, lest you forget the covenant of the Lord your God, which he made with you, and make a carved image, the form of anything that the Lord your God has forbidden you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is a consuming fire, a jealous God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you father children and children's children, and have grown old in the land, if you act corruptly by making a carved image in the form of anything, and by doing what is evil in the sight of the Lord your God, so as to provoke him to anger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I call heaven and earth to witness against you today, that you will soon utterly perish from the land that you are going over the Jordan to possess. You will not live long in it, but will be utterly destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord will scatter you among the peoples, and you will be left few in number among the nations where the Lord will drive you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there you will serve gods of wood and stone, the work of human hands, that neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from there you will seek the Lord your God and you will find him, if you search after him with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you are in tribulation, and all these things come upon you in the latter days, you will return to the Lord your God and obey his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is a merciful God. He will not leave you or destroy you or forget the covenant with your fathers that he swore to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For ask now of the days that are past, which were before you, since the day that God created man on the earth, and ask from one end of heaven to the other, whether such a great thing as this has ever happened or was ever heard of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did any people ever hear the voice of a god speaking out of the midst of the fire, as you have heard, and still live?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or has any god ever attempted to go and take a nation for himself from the midst of another nation, by trials, by signs, by wonders, and by war, by a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, and by great deeds of terror, all of which the Lord your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To you it was shown, that you might know that the Lord is God; there is no other besides him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of heaven he let you hear his voice, that he might discipline you. And on earth he let you see his great fire, and you heard his words out of the midst of the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because he loved your fathers and chose their offspring after them and brought you out of Egypt with his own presence, by his great power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: driving out before you nations greater and mightier than you, to bring you in, to give you their land for an inheritance, as it is this day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: know therefore today, and lay it to your heart, that the Lord is God in heaven above and on the earth beneath; there is no other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you shall keep his statutes and his commandments, which I command you today, that it may go well with you and with your children after you, and that you may prolong your days in the land that the Lord your God is giving you for all time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses set apart three cities in the east beyond the Jordan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the manslayer might flee there, anyone who kills his neighbor unintentionally, without being at enmity with him in time past; he may flee to one of these cities and save his life:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezer in the wilderness on the tableland for the Reubenites, Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites, and Golan in Bashan for the Manassites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law that Moses set before the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the testimonies, the statutes, and the rules, which Moses spoke to the people of Israel when they came out of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beyond the Jordan in the valley opposite Beth-peor, in the land of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, whom Moses and the people of Israel defeated when they came out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took possession of his land and the land of Og, the king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who lived to the east beyond the Jordan;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Aroer, which is on the edge of the Valley of the Arnon, as far as Mount Sirion (that is, Hermon),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: together with all the Arabah on the east side of the Jordan as far as the Sea of the Arabah, under the slopes of Pisgah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses summoned all Israel and said to them, “Hear, O Israel, the statutes and the rules that I speak in your hearing today, and you shall learn them and be careful to do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not with our fathers did the Lord make this covenant, but with us, who are all of us here alive today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke with you face to face at the mountain, out of the midst of the fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while I stood between the Lord and you at that time, to declare to you the word of the Lord. For you were afraid because of the fire, and you did not go up into the mountain. He said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall have no other gods before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall not make for yourself a carved image, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is on the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not bow down to them or serve them; for I the Lord your God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children to the third and fourth generation of those who hate me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but showing steadfast love to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Observe the Sabbath day, to keep it holy, as the Lord your God commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God. On it you shall not do any work, you or your son or your daughter or your male servant or your female servant, or your ox or your donkey or any of your livestock, or the sojourner who is within your gates, that your male servant and your female servant may rest as well as you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and the Lord your God brought you out from there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm. Therefore the Lord your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Honor your father and your mother, as the Lord your God commanded you, that your days may be long, and that it may go well with you in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall not murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And you shall not commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And you shall not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And you shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And you shall not covet your neighbor's wife. And you shall not desire your neighbor's house, his field, or his male servant, or his female servant, his ox, or his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor's.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These words the Lord spoke to all your assembly at the mountain out of the midst of the fire, the cloud, and the thick darkness, with a loud voice; and he added no more. And he wrote them on two tablets of stone and gave them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as you heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, you came near to me, all the heads of your tribes, and your elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you said, ‘Behold, the Lord our God has shown us his glory and greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the midst of the fire. This day we have seen God speak with man, and man still live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore why should we die? For this great fire will consume us. If we hear the voice of the Lord our God any more, we shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is there of all flesh, that has heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the midst of fire as we have, and has still lived?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go near and hear all that the Lord our God will say, and speak to us all that the Lord our God will speak to you, and we will hear and do it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And the Lord heard your words, when you spoke to me. And the Lord said to me, ‘I have heard the words of this people, which they have spoken to you. They are right in all that they have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh that they had such a heart as this always, to fear me and to keep all my commandments, that it might go well with them and with their descendants forever!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and say to them, “Return to your tents.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, stand here by me, and I will tell you the whole commandment and the statutes and the rules that you shall teach them, that they may do them in the land that I am giving them to possess.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall be careful therefore to do as the Lord your God has commanded you. You shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall walk in all the way that the Lord your God has commanded you, that you may live, and that it may go well with you, and that you may live long in the land that you shall possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now this is the commandment—the statutes and the rules—that the Lord your God commanded me to teach you, that you may do them in the land to which you are going over, to possess it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may fear the Lord your God, you and your son and your son's son, by keeping all his statutes and his commandments, which I command you, all the days of your life, and that your days may be long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear therefore, O Israel, and be careful to do them, that it may go well with you, and that you may multiply greatly, as the Lord, the God of your fathers, has promised you, in a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these words that I command you today shall be on your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall bind them as a sign on your hand, and they shall be as frontlets between your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And when the Lord your God brings you into the land that he swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give you—with great and good cities that you did not build,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and houses full of all good things that you did not fill, and cisterns that you did not dig, and vineyards and olive trees that you did not plant—and when you eat and are full,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then take care lest you forget the Lord, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the Lord your God you shall fear. Him you shall serve and by his name you shall swear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not go after other gods, the gods of the peoples who are around you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Lord your God in your midst is a jealous God—lest the anger of the Lord your God be kindled against you, and he destroy you from off the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not put the Lord your God to the test, as you tested him at Massah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall diligently keep the commandments of the Lord your God, and his testimonies and his statutes, which he has commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall do what is right and good in the sight of the Lord, that it may go well with you, and that you may go in and take possession of the good land that the Lord swore to give to your fathers
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by thrusting out all your enemies from before you, as the Lord has promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When your son asks you in time to come, ‘What is the meaning of the testimonies and the statutes and the rules that the Lord our God has commanded you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall say to your son, ‘We were Pharaoh's slaves in Egypt. And the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord showed signs and wonders, great and grievous, against Egypt and against Pharaoh and all his household, before our eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought us out from there, that he might bring us in and give us the land that he swore to give to our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear the Lord our God, for our good always, that he might preserve us alive, as we are this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will be righteousness for us, if we are careful to do all this commandment before the Lord our God, as he has commanded us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Lord your God brings you into the land that you are entering to take possession of it, and clears away many nations before you, the Hittites, the Girgashites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, seven nations more numerous and mightier than you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when the Lord your God gives them over to you, and you defeat them, then you must devote them to complete destruction. You shall make no covenant with them and show no mercy to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not intermarry with them, giving your daughters to their sons or taking their daughters for your sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they would turn away your sons from following me, to serve other gods. Then the anger of the Lord would be kindled against you, and he would destroy you quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thus shall you deal with them: you shall break down their altars and dash in pieces their pillars and chop down their Asherim and burn their carved images with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For you are a people holy to the Lord your God. The Lord your God has chosen you to be a people for his treasured possession, out of all the peoples who are on the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was not because you were more in number than any other people that the Lord set his love on you and chose you, for you were the fewest of all peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but it is because the Lord loves you and is keeping the oath that he swore to your fathers, that the Lord has brought you out with a mighty hand and redeemed you from the house of slavery, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know therefore that the Lord your God is God, the faithful God who keeps covenant and steadfast love with those who love him and keep his commandments, to a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and repays to their face those who hate him, by destroying them. He will not be slack with one who hates him. He will repay him to his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall therefore be careful to do the commandment and the statutes and the rules that I command you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And because you listen to these rules and keep and do them, the Lord your God will keep with you the covenant and the steadfast love that he swore to your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will love you, bless you, and multiply you. He will also bless the fruit of your womb and the fruit of your ground, your grain and your wine and your oil, the increase of your herds and the young of your flock, in the land that he swore to your fathers to give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall be blessed above all peoples. There shall not be male or female barren among you or among your livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord will take away from you all sickness, and none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which you knew, will he inflict on you, but he will lay them on all who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall consume all the peoples that the Lord your God will give over to you. Your eye shall not pity them, neither shall you serve their gods, for that would be a snare to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you say in your heart, ‘These nations are greater than I. How can I dispossess them?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall not be afraid of them but you shall remember what the Lord your God did to Pharaoh and to all Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the great trials that your eyes saw, the signs, the wonders, the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm, by which the Lord your God brought you out. So will the Lord your God do to all the peoples of whom you are afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the Lord your God will send hornets among them, until those who are left and hide themselves from you are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not be in dread of them, for the Lord your God is in your midst, a great and awesome God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will clear away these nations before you little by little. You may not make an end of them at once, lest the wild beasts grow too numerous for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord your God will give them over to you and throw them into great confusion, until they are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will give their kings into your hand, and you shall make their name perish from under heaven. No one shall be able to stand against you until you have destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The carved images of their gods you shall burn with fire. You shall not covet the silver or the gold that is on them or take it for yourselves, lest you be ensnared by it, for it is an abomination to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not bring an abominable thing into your house and become devoted to destruction like it. You shall utterly detest and abhor it, for it is devoted to destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The whole commandment that I command you today you shall be careful to do, that you may live and multiply, and go in and possess the land that the Lord swore to give to your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall remember the whole way that the Lord your God has led you these forty years in the wilderness, that he might humble you, testing you to know what was in your heart, whether you would keep his commandments or not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he humbled you and let you hunger and fed you with manna, which you did not know, nor did your fathers know, that he might make you know that man does not live by bread alone, but man lives by every word that comes from the mouth of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your clothing did not wear out on you and your foot did not swell these forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know then in your heart that, as a man disciplines his son, the Lord your God disciplines you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall keep the commandments of the Lord your God by walking in his ways and by fearing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is bringing you into a good land, a land of brooks of water, of fountains and springs, flowing out in the valleys and hills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land of wheat and barley, of vines and fig trees and pomegranates, a land of olive trees and honey,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land in which you will eat bread without scarcity, in which you will lack nothing, a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills you can dig copper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall eat and be full, and you shall bless the Lord your God for the good land he has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take care lest you forget the Lord your God by not keeping his commandments and his rules and his statutes, which I command you today,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest, when you have eaten and are full and have built good houses and live in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when your herds and flocks multiply and your silver and gold is multiplied and all that you have is multiplied,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then your heart be lifted up, and you forget the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who led you through the great and terrifying wilderness, with its fiery serpents and scorpions and thirsty ground where there was no water, who brought you water out of the flinty rock,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who fed you in the wilderness with manna that your fathers did not know, that he might humble you and test you, to do you good in the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware lest you say in your heart, ‘My power and the might of my hand have gotten me this wealth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall remember the Lord your God, for it is he who gives you power to get wealth, that he may confirm his covenant that he swore to your fathers, as it is this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you forget the Lord your God and go after other gods and serve them and worship them, I solemnly warn you today that you shall surely perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like the nations that the Lord makes to perish before you, so shall you perish, because you would not obey the voice of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear, O Israel: you are to cross over the Jordan today, to go in to dispossess nations greater and mightier than you, cities great and fortified up to heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a people great and tall, the sons of the Anakim, whom you know, and of whom you have heard it said, ‘Who can stand before the sons of Anak?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know therefore today that he who goes over before you as a consuming fire is the Lord your God. He will destroy them and subdue them before you. So you shall drive them out and make them perish quickly, as the Lord has promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not say in your heart, after the Lord your God has thrust them out before you, ‘It is because of my righteousness that the Lord has brought me in to possess this land,’ whereas it is because of the wickedness of these nations that the Lord is driving them out before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not because of your righteousness or the uprightness of your heart are you going in to possess their land, but because of the wickedness of these nations the Lord your God is driving them out from before you, and that he may confirm the word that the Lord swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Know, therefore, that the Lord your God is not giving you this good land to possess because of your righteousness, for you are a stubborn people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember and do not forget how you provoked the Lord your God to wrath in the wilderness. From the day you came out of the land of Egypt until you came to this place, you have been rebellious against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even at Horeb you provoked the Lord to wrath, and the Lord was so angry with you that he was ready to destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I went up the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant that the Lord made with you, I remained on the mountain forty days and forty nights. I neither ate bread nor drank water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord gave me the two tablets of stone written with the finger of God, and on them were all the words that the Lord had spoken with you on the mountain out of the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the end of forty days and forty nights the Lord gave me the two tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, ‘Arise, go down quickly from here, for your people whom you have brought from Egypt have acted corruptly. They have turned aside quickly out of the way that I commanded them; they have made themselves a metal image.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Furthermore, the Lord said to me, ‘I have seen this people, and behold, it is a stubborn people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let me alone, that I may destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven. And I will make of you a nation mightier and greater than they.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I turned and came down from the mountain, and the mountain was burning with fire. And the two tablets of the covenant were in my two hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I looked, and behold, you had sinned against the Lord your God. You had made yourselves a golden calf. You had turned aside quickly from the way that the Lord had commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took hold of the two tablets and threw them out of my two hands and broke them before your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I lay prostrate before the Lord as before, forty days and forty nights. I neither ate bread nor drank water, because of all the sin that you had committed, in doing what was evil in the sight of the Lord to provoke him to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure that the Lord bore against you, so that he was ready to destroy you. But the Lord listened to me that time also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord was so angry with Aaron that he was ready to destroy him. And I prayed for Aaron also at the same time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took the sinful thing, the calf that you had made, and burned it with fire and crushed it, grinding it very small, until it was as fine as dust. And I threw the dust of it into the brook that ran down from the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At Taberah also, and at Massah and at Kibroth-hattaavah you provoked the Lord to wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Lord sent you from Kadesh-barnea, saying, ‘Go up and take possession of the land that I have given you,’ then you rebelled against the commandment of the Lord your God and did not believe him or obey his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have been rebellious against the Lord from the day that I knew you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So I lay prostrate before the Lord for these forty days and forty nights, because the Lord had said he would destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I prayed to the Lord, ‘O Lord God, do not destroy your people and your heritage, whom you have redeemed through your greatness, whom you have brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Do not regard the stubbornness of this people, or their wickedness or their sin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest the land from which you brought us say, “Because the Lord was not able to bring them into the land that he promised them, and because he hated them, he has brought them out to put them to death in the wilderness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they are your people and your heritage, whom you brought out by your great power and by your outstretched arm.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time the Lord said to me, ‘Cut for yourself two tablets of stone like the first, and come up to me on the mountain and make an ark of wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets that you broke, and you shall put them in the ark.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I made an ark of acacia wood, and cut two tablets of stone like the first, and went up the mountain with the two tablets in my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he wrote on the tablets, in the same writing as before, the Ten Commandments that the Lord had spoken to you on the mountain out of the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly. And the Lord gave them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I turned and came down from the mountain and put the tablets in the ark that I had made. And there they are, as the Lord commanded me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The people of Israel journeyed from Beeroth Bene-jaakan to Moserah. There Aaron died, and there he was buried. And his son Eleazar ministered as priest in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they journeyed to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land with brooks of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the Lord set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the covenant of the Lord to stand before the Lord to minister to him and to bless in his name, to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Levi has no portion or inheritance with his brothers. The Lord is his inheritance, as the Lord your God said to him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I myself stayed on the mountain, as at the first time, forty days and forty nights, and the Lord listened to me that time also. The Lord was unwilling to destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, ‘Arise, go on your journey at the head of the people, so that they may go in and possess the land, which I swore to their fathers to give them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now, Israel, what does the Lord your God require of you, but to fear the Lord your God, to walk in all his ways, to love him, to serve the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to keep the commandments and statutes of the Lord, which I am commanding you today for your good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, to the Lord your God belong heaven and the heaven of heavens, the earth with all that is in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the Lord set his heart in love on your fathers and chose their offspring after them, you above all peoples, as you are this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no longer stubborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great, the mighty, and the awesome God, who is not partial and takes no bribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He executes justice for the fatherless and the widow, and loves the sojourner, giving him food and clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love the sojourner, therefore, for you were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall fear the Lord your God. You shall serve him and hold fast to him, and by his name you shall swear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is your praise. He is your God, who has done for you these great and terrifying things that your eyes have seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your fathers went down to Egypt seventy persons, and now the Lord your God has made you as numerous as the stars of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall therefore love the Lord your God and keep his charge, his statutes, his rules, and his commandments always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And consider today (since I am not speaking to your children who have not known or seen it), consider the discipline of the Lord your God, his greatness, his mighty hand and his outstretched arm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his signs and his deeds that he did in Egypt to Pharaoh the king of Egypt and to all his land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and what he did to the army of Egypt, to their horses and to their chariots, how he made the water of the Red Sea flow over them as they pursued after you, and how the Lord has destroyed them to this day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and what he did to you in the wilderness, until you came to this place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and what he did to Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab, son of Reuben, how the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up, with their households, their tents, and every living thing that followed them, in the midst of all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For your eyes have seen all the great work of the Lord that he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall therefore keep the whole commandment that I command you today, that you may be strong, and go in and take possession of the land that you are going over to possess,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that you may live long in the land that the Lord swore to your fathers to give to them and to their offspring, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the land that you are entering to take possession of it is not like the land of Egypt, from which you have come, where you sowed your seed and irrigated it, like a garden of vegetables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the land that you are going over to possess is a land of hills and valleys, which drinks water by the rain from heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land that the Lord your God cares for. The eyes of the Lord your God are always upon it, from the beginning of the year to the end of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And if you will indeed obey my commandments that I command you today, to love the Lord your God, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he will give the rain for your land in its season, the early rain and the later rain, that you may gather in your grain and your wine and your oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will give grass in your fields for your livestock, and you shall eat and be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take care lest your heart be deceived, and you turn aside and serve other gods and worship them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the anger of the Lord will be kindled against you, and he will shut up the heavens, so that there will be no rain, and the land will yield no fruit, and you will perish quickly off the good land that the Lord is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall therefore lay up these words of mine in your heart and in your soul, and you shall bind them as a sign on your hand, and they shall be as frontlets between your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall teach them to your children, talking of them when you are sitting in your house, and when you are walking by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that your days and the days of your children may be multiplied in the land that the Lord swore to your fathers to give them, as long as the heavens are above the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you will be careful to do all this commandment that I command you to do, loving the Lord your God, walking in all his ways, and holding fast to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord will drive out all these nations before you, and you will dispossess nations greater and mightier than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every place on which the sole of your foot treads shall be yours. Your territory shall be from the wilderness to the Lebanon and from the River, the river Euphrates, to the western sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one shall be able to stand against you. The Lord your God will lay the fear of you and the dread of you on all the land that you shall tread, as he promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the blessing, if you obey the commandments of the Lord your God, which I command you today,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the curse, if you do not obey the commandments of the Lord your God, but turn aside from the way that I am commanding you today, to go after other gods that you have not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Lord your God brings you into the land that you are entering to take possession of it, you shall set the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they not beyond the Jordan, west of the road, toward the going down of the sun, in the land of the Canaanites who live in the Arabah, opposite Gilgal, beside the oak of Moreh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are to cross over the Jordan to go in to take possession of the land that the Lord your God is giving you. And when you possess it and live in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall be careful to do all the statutes and the rules that I am setting before you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the statutes and rules that you shall be careful to do in the land that the Lord, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess, all the days that you live on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall surely destroy all the places where the nations whom you shall dispossess served their gods, on the high mountains and on the hills and under every green tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall tear down their altars and dash in pieces their pillars and burn their Asherim with fire. You shall chop down the carved images of their gods and destroy their name out of that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not worship the Lord your God in that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall seek the place that the Lord your God will choose out of all your tribes to put his name and make his habitation there. There you shall go,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there you shall bring your burnt offerings and your sacrifices, your tithes and the contribution that you present, your vow offerings, your freewill offerings, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there you shall eat before the Lord your God, and you shall rejoice, you and your households, in all that you undertake, in which the Lord your God has blessed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not do according to all that we are doing here today, everyone doing whatever is right in his own eyes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you have not as yet come to the rest and to the inheritance that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you go over the Jordan and live in the land that the Lord your God is giving you to inherit, and when he gives you rest from all your enemies around, so that you live in safety,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then to the place that the Lord your God will choose, to make his name dwell there, there you shall bring all that I command you: your burnt offerings and your sacrifices, your tithes and the contribution that you present, and all your finest vow offerings that you vow to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall rejoice before the Lord your God, you and your sons and your daughters, your male servants and your female servants, and the Levite that is within your towns, since he has no portion or inheritance with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take care that you do not offer your burnt offerings at any place that you see,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but at the place that the Lord will choose in one of your tribes, there you shall offer your burnt offerings, and there you shall do all that I am commanding you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, you may slaughter and eat meat within any of your towns, as much as you desire, according to the blessing of the Lord your God that he has given you. The unclean and the clean may eat of it, as of the gazelle and as of the deer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only you shall not eat the blood; you shall pour it out on the earth like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may not eat within your towns the tithe of your grain or of your wine or of your oil, or the firstborn of your herd or of your flock, or any of your vow offerings that you vow, or your freewill offerings or the contribution that you present,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you shall eat them before the Lord your God in the place that the Lord your God will choose, you and your son and your daughter, your male servant and your female servant, and the Levite who is within your towns. And you shall rejoice before the Lord your God in all that you undertake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take care that you do not neglect the Levite as long as you live in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Lord your God enlarges your territory, as he has promised you, and you say, ‘I will eat meat,’ because you crave meat, you may eat meat whenever you desire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the place that the Lord your God will choose to put his name there is too far from you, then you may kill any of your herd or your flock, which the Lord has given you, as I have commanded you, and you may eat within your towns whenever you desire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the gazelle or the deer is eaten, so you may eat of it. The unclean and the clean alike may eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only be sure that you do not eat the blood, for the blood is the life, and you shall not eat the life with the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not eat it; you shall pour it out on the earth like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not eat it, that all may go well with you and with your children after you, when you do what is right in the sight of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the holy things that are due from you, and your vow offerings, you shall take, and you shall go to the place that the Lord will choose,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, on the altar of the Lord your God. The blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out on the altar of the Lord your God, but the flesh you may eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful to obey all these words that I command you, that it may go well with you and with your children after you forever, when you do what is good and right in the sight of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Lord your God cuts off before you the nations whom you go in to dispossess, and you dispossess them and dwell in their land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take care that you be not ensnared to follow them, after they have been destroyed before you, and that you do not inquire about their gods, saying, ‘How did these nations serve their gods?—that I also may do the same.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not worship the Lord your God in that way, for every abominable thing that the Lord hates they have done for their gods, for they even burn their sons and their daughters in the fire to their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everything that I command you, you shall be careful to do. You shall not add to it or take from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a prophet or a dreamer of dreams arises among you and gives you a sign or a wonder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sign or wonder that he tells you comes to pass, and if he says, ‘Let us go after other gods,’ which you have not known, ‘and let us serve them,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall not listen to the words of that prophet or that dreamer of dreams. For the Lord your God is testing you, to know whether you love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall walk after the Lord your God and fear him and keep his commandments and obey his voice, and you shall serve him and hold fast to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that prophet or that dreamer of dreams shall be put to death, because he has taught rebellion against the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you out of the house of slavery, to make you leave the way in which the Lord your God commanded you to walk. So you shall purge the evil from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If your brother, the son of your mother, or your son or your daughter or the wife you embrace or your friend who is as your own soul entices you secretly, saying, ‘Let us go and serve other gods,’ which neither you nor your fathers have known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: some of the gods of the peoples who are around you, whether near you or far off from you, from the one end of the earth to the other,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall not yield to him or listen to him, nor shall your eye pity him, nor shall you spare him, nor shall you conceal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall kill him. Your hand shall be first against him to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall stone him to death with stones, because he sought to draw you away from the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all Israel shall hear and fear and never again do any such wickedness as this among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you hear in one of your cities, which the Lord your God is giving you to dwell there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that certain worthless fellows have gone out among you and have drawn away the inhabitants of their city, saying, ‘Let us go and serve other gods,’ which you have not known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall inquire and make search and ask diligently. And behold, if it be true and certain that such an abomination has been done among you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall surely put the inhabitants of that city to the sword, devoting it to destruction, all who are in it and its cattle, with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall gather all its spoil into the midst of its open square and burn the city and all its spoil with fire, as a whole burnt offering to the Lord your God. It shall be a heap forever. It shall not be built again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the devoted things shall stick to your hand, that the Lord may turn from the fierceness of his anger and show you mercy and have compassion on you and multiply you, as he swore to your fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you obey the voice of the Lord your God, keeping all his commandments that I am commanding you today, and doing what is right in the sight of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are the sons of the Lord your God. You shall not cut yourselves or make any baldness on your foreheads for the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are a people holy to the Lord your God, and the Lord has chosen you to be a people for his treasured possession, out of all the peoples who are on the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not eat any abomination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the animals you may eat: the ox, the sheep, the goat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, and the mountain sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every animal that parts the hoof and has the hoof cloven in two and chews the cud, among the animals, you may eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet of those that chew the cud or have the hoof cloven you shall not eat these: the camel, the hare, and the rock badger, because they chew the cud but do not part the hoof, are unclean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the pig, because it parts the hoof but does not chew the cud, is unclean for you. Their flesh you shall not eat, and their carcasses you shall not touch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Of all that are in the waters you may eat these: whatever has fins and scales you may eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever does not have fins and scales you shall not eat; it is unclean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You may eat all clean birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these are the ones that you shall not eat: the eagle, the bearded vulture, the black vulture,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the kite, the falcon of any kind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every raven of any kind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull, the hawk of any kind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the little owl and the short-eared owl, the barn owl
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the tawny owl, the carrion vulture and the cormorant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the stork, the heron of any kind; the hoopoe and the bat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all winged insects are unclean for you; they shall not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All clean winged things you may eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You shall not eat anything that has died naturally. You may give it to the sojourner who is within your towns, that he may eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner. For you are a people holy to the Lord your God.
“You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall tithe all the yield of your seed that comes from the field year by year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And before the Lord your God, in the place that he will choose, to make his name dwell there, you shall eat the tithe of your grain, of your wine, and of your oil, and the firstborn of your herd and flock, that you may learn to fear the Lord your God always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the way is too long for you, so that you are not able to carry the tithe, when the Lord your God blesses you, because the place is too far from you, which the Lord your God chooses, to set his name there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall turn it into money and bind up the money in your hand and go to the place that the Lord your God chooses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and spend the money for whatever you desire—oxen or sheep or wine or strong drink, whatever your appetite craves. And you shall eat there before the Lord your God and rejoice, you and your household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not neglect the Levite who is within your towns, for he has no portion or inheritance with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At the end of every three years you shall bring out all the tithe of your produce in the same year and lay it up within your towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Levite, because he has no portion or inheritance with you, and the sojourner, the fatherless, and the widow, who are within your towns, shall come and eat and be filled, that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hands that you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At the end of every seven years you shall grant a release.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the manner of the release: every creditor shall release what he has lent to his neighbor. He shall not exact it of his neighbor, his brother, because the Lord's release has been proclaimed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of a foreigner you may exact it, but whatever of yours is with your brother your hand shall release.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there will be no poor among you; for the Lord will bless you in the land that the Lord your God is giving you for an inheritance to possess—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if only you will strictly obey the voice of the Lord your God, being careful to do all this commandment that I command you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God will bless you, as he promised you, and you shall lend to many nations, but you shall not borrow, and you shall rule over many nations, but they shall not rule over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
