verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when many evils and troubles have come upon them, this song shall confront them as a witness (for it will live unforgotten in the mouths of their offspring). For I know what they are inclined to do even today, before I have brought them into the land that I swore to give.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses wrote this song the same day and taught it to the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord commissioned Joshua the son of Nun and said, “Be strong and courageous, for you shall bring the people of Israel into the land that I swore to give them. I will be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses had finished writing the words of this law in a book to the very end,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses commanded the Levites who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take this Book of the Law and put it by the side of the ark of the covenant of the Lord your God, that it may be there for a witness against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know how rebellious and stubborn you are. Behold, even today while I am yet alive with you, you have been rebellious against the Lord. How much more after my death!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assemble to me all the elders of your tribes and your officers, that I may speak these words in their ears and call heaven and earth to witness against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know that after my death you will surely act corruptly and turn aside from the way that I have commanded you. And in the days to come evil will befall you, because you will do what is evil in the sight of the Lord, provoking him to anger through the work of your hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses spoke the words of this song until they were finished, in the ears of all the assembly of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak,
    and let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my teaching drop as the rain,
    my speech distill as the dew,
like gentle rain upon the tender grass,
    and like showers upon the herb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will proclaim the name of the Lord;
    ascribe greatness to our God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Rock, his work is perfect,
    for all his ways are justice.
A God of faithfulness and without iniquity,
    just and upright is he.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do you thus repay the Lord,
    you foolish and senseless people?
Is not he your father, who created you,
    who made you and established you?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When the Most High gave to the nations their inheritance,
    when he divided mankind,
he fixed the borders of the peoples
    according to the number of the sons of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord's portion is his people,
    Jacob his allotted heritage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He found him in a desert land,
    and in the howling waste of the wilderness;
he encircled him, he cared for him,
    he kept him as the apple of his eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like an eagle that stirs up its nest,
    that flutters over its young,
spreading out its wings, catching them,
    bearing them on its pinions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the Lord alone guided him,
    no foreign god was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made him ride on the high places of the land,
    and he ate the produce of the field,
and he suckled him with honey out of the rock,
    and oil out of the flinty rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Curds from the herd, and milk from the flock,
    with fat of lambs,
rams of Bashan and goats,
    with the very finest of the wheat—
    and you drank foaming wine made from the blood of the grape.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They stirred him to jealousy with strange gods;
    with abominations they provoked him to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sacrificed to demons that were no gods,
    to gods they had never known,
to new gods that had come recently,
    whom your fathers had never dreaded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You were unmindful of the Rock that bore you,
    and you forgot the God who gave you birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord saw it and spurned them,
    because of the provocation of his sons and his daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For a fire is kindled by my anger,
    and it burns to the depths of Sheol,
devours the earth and its increase,
    and sets on fire the foundations of the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘And I will heap disasters upon them;
    I will spend my arrows on them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they shall be wasted with hunger,
    and devoured by plague
    and poisonous pestilence;
I will send the teeth of beasts against them,
    with the venom of things that crawl in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Outdoors the sword shall bereave,
    and indoors terror,
for young man and woman alike,
    the nursing child with the man of gray hairs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would have said, “I will cut them to pieces;
    I will wipe them from human memory,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
had I not feared provocation by the enemy,
    lest their adversaries should misunderstand,
lest they should say, “Our hand is triumphant,
    it was not the Lord who did all this.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For they are a nation void of counsel,
    and there is no understanding in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If they were wise, they would understand this;
    they would discern their latter end!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How could one have chased a thousand,
    and two have put ten thousand to flight,
unless their Rock had sold them,
    and the Lord had given them up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their rock is not as our Rock;
    our enemies are by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
their wine is the poison of serpents
    and the cruel venom of asps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘Is not this laid up in store with me,
    sealed up in my treasuries?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will vindicate his people
    and have compassion on his servants,
when he sees that their power is gone
    and there is none remaining, bond or free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he will say, ‘Where are their gods,
    the rock in which they took refuge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who ate the fat of their sacrifices
    and drank the wine of their drink offering?
Let them rise up and help you;
    let them be your protection!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I lift up my hand to heaven
    and swear, As I live forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if I sharpen my flashing sword
    and my hand takes hold on judgment,
I will take vengeance on my adversaries
    and will repay those who hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make my arrows drunk with blood,
    and my sword shall devour flesh—
with the blood of the slain and the captives,
    from the long-haired heads of the enemy.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Rejoice with him, O heavens;
    bow down to him, all gods,
for he avenges the blood of his children
    and takes vengeance on his adversaries.
He repays those who hate him
    and cleanses his people's land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses came and recited all the words of this song in the hearing of the people, he and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses had finished speaking all these words to all Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said to them, “Take to heart all the words by which I am warning you today, that you may command them to your children, that they may be careful to do all the words of this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is no empty word for you, but your very life, and by this word you shall live long in the land that you are going over the Jordan to possess.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That very day the Lord spoke to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go up this mountain of the Abarim, Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, opposite Jericho, and view the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the people of Israel for a possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And die on the mountain which you go up, and be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother died in Mount Hor and was gathered to his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because you broke faith with me in the midst of the people of Israel at the waters of Meribah-kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin, and because you did not treat me as holy in the midst of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you shall see the land before you, but you shall not go there, into the land that I am giving to the people of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the blessing with which Moses the man of God blessed the people of Israel before his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, he loved his people,
    all his holy ones were in his hand;
so they followed in your steps,
    receiving direction from you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when Moses commanded us a law,
    as a possession for the assembly of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus the Lord became king in Jeshurun,
    when the heads of the people were gathered,
    all the tribes of Israel together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Let Reuben live, and not die,
    but let his men be few.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And this he said of Judah:
“Hear, O Lord, the voice of Judah,
    and bring him in to his people.
With your hands contend for him,
    and be a help against his adversaries.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And of Levi he said,
“Give to Levi your Thummim,
    and your Urim to your godly one,
whom you tested at Massah,
    with whom you quarreled at the waters of Meribah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who said of his father and mother,
    ‘I regard them not’;
he disowned his brothers
    and ignored his children.
For they observed your word
    and kept your covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall teach Jacob your rules
    and Israel your law;
they shall put incense before you
    and whole burnt offerings on your altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless, O Lord, his substance,
    and accept the work of his hands;
crush the loins of his adversaries,
    of those who hate him, that they rise not again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Benjamin he said,
“The beloved of the Lord dwells in safety.
The High God surrounds him all day long,
    and dwells between his shoulders.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And of Joseph he said,
“Blessed by the Lord be his land,
    with the choicest gifts of heaven above,
    and of the deep that crouches beneath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with the choicest fruits of the sun
    and the rich yield of the months,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with the finest produce of the ancient mountains
    and the abundance of the everlasting hills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with the best gifts of the earth and its fullness
    and the favor of him who dwells in the bush.
May these rest on the head of Joseph,
    on the pate of him who is prince among his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And of Zebulun he said,
“Rejoice, Zebulun, in your going out,
    and Issachar, in your tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And of Gad he said,
“Blessed be he who enlarges Gad!
    Gad crouches like a lion;
    he tears off arm and scalp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He chose the best of the land for himself,
    for there a commander's portion was reserved;
and he came with the heads of the people,
    with Israel he executed the justice of the Lord,
    and his judgments for Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And of Dan he said,
“Dan is a lion's cub
    that leaps from Bashan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And of Naphtali he said,
“O Naphtali, sated with favor,
    and full of the blessing of the Lord,
    possess the lake and the south.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your bars shall be iron and bronze,
    and as your days, so shall your strength be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“There is none like God, O Jeshurun,
    who rides through the heavens to your help,
    through the skies in his majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eternal God is your dwelling place,
    and underneath are the everlasting arms.
And he thrust out the enemy before you
    and said, ‘Destroy.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Israel lived in safety,
    Jacob lived alone,
in a land of grain and wine,
    whose heavens drop down dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are you, O Israel! Who is like you,
    a people saved by the Lord,
the shield of your help,
    and the sword of your triumph!
Your enemies shall come fawning to you,
    and you shall tread upon their backs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which is opposite Jericho. And the Lord showed him all the land, Gilead as far as Dan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all Naphtali, the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the land of Judah as far as the western sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Negeb, and the Plain, that is, the Valley of Jericho the city of palm trees, as far as Zoar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to him, “This is the land of which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, ‘I will give it to your offspring.’ I have let you see it with your eyes, but you shall not go over there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses the servant of the Lord died there in the land of Moab, according to the word of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he buried him in the valley in the land of Moab opposite Beth-peor; but no one knows the place of his burial to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was 120 years old when he died. His eye was undimmed, and his vigor unabated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days. Then the days of weeping and mourning for Moses were ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had laid his hands on him. So the people of Israel obeyed him and did as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there has not arisen a prophet since in Israel like Moses, whom the Lord knew face to face,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: none like him for all the signs and the wonders that the Lord sent him to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh and to all his servants and to all his land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for all the mighty power and all the great deeds of terror that Moses did in the sight of all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
